articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Is this your... third blog now?
articles.contents:
Charlotte Hadley
Hey! I‚Äôm Charlie (she/her) and have been teaching and consulting with R and Shiny since 2016.
I co-run the awesome R in 3 Months programme at R for the Rest of Us.
I have 5 courses about R available on LinkedIn Learning
I‚Äôm very proud of this Mapping with R course which is designed for folks without mapping or GIS experience.
As well as these things, I‚Äôm a trans and LGBT rights activist üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà. All tech is political. Black Lives Matter.
What‚Äôs this blog for?
I‚Äôve had several failed R blogs which tried to do too many things:
www.visibledata.co.uk was designed as the company website for my R consultancy work. It was abandoned in favour of‚Ä¶
www.findingyourway.io was to accompany a book project I abandoned. It has lots of wonderfully customised (Bootstrap flavoured) CSS.
But these days I do my consultancy through the awesome R for The Rest of Us team. That‚Äôs also where my fancy markety blogposts.
This is going to be the home for #30DayChartChallenge, #TidyTuesday and other things.
To prevent this from going the way of the abandoned projects, here are my rules:
All custom CSS needs to be declared here.
All {distill} modifications need to be declared here.
Customisations
Showing recent posts on the home page
The home page shows a list of all blogposts, which is achieved by adding this to the index.Rmd file:

---
title: "Posts"
listing: posts
site: distill::distill_website
---

To place additional content about the posts I make use of <d-byline></d-byline> which forces the content below into a comfortable position.
Tutorials used
https://themockup.blog/posts/2020-08-01-building-a-blog-with-distill/
